alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Crawford; La Crosse; Richland; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 4:46AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Reduced Visibilities in Snow Showers this Morning... A narrow band of moderate to heavy snow is rapidly progressing into southeast Minnesota. High snow rates and strong winds of 20-30 mph are leading to brief periods of reduced visibilities and rapid snowfall accumulation on roadways. Visibilities have generally fallen to 1/2 to 1 mile in the heaviest snow, though a few locations have fallen to 1/4 of a mile for brief periods of time. As of 4:30am, the snow band was moving into the Rochester area and will slide east towards La Crosse around 6-7 am. The band looks to slow down and linger around the Mississippi River Valley through the morning and slowly weaken by midday. This snow band will impact the morning commute, therefore drivers should be prepared for rapidly changing conditions with reduced visibilities and slick spots on area roads--in particular bridges and lesser traveled roads. Total snow amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Crawford; La Crosse; Richland; Trempealeau; Vernon
